body:
I have installed composer-cli and the following command also fails with the same error:

composer network ping -c admin@letters-of-credit-network

Need to ensure you clear your browser cache, I recommend using incognito mode in chrome. Also there was an issue with the online playground giving similar errors due to problems with the cloud provider.
This would not have been specific to Letter of Credit sample.
Closing as this issue contains no meaningful description or information.

The source is available in this repository so you can inspect the code to see how it works. axios is used to send a requests to a rest server, for example.
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer-sample-applications/blob/f40b78da35d2614d2e2932c21adb63520d3311f6/packages/letters-of-credit/src/components/LetterOfCredit/LetterOfCredit.js#L75

Maybe you should wait for some time. This also happened to me. But then I try to start  composer-rest-server on my sever (not on docker). And then I can see the pages when I start hyperledger/letters-of-credit:latest on docker .

I suggest you first make sure  http://localhost:3000/explorer/ is normally connected. Hope you run the app successfullyÔºÅ

Closing as no further entries from reporter. Assume resolved.
Closing because of DCO nonsense :(
Ability to set custom config introduced by #140
This is a sample and as such if you want to change the behaviour you can modify it for your own needs.
Thanks for the PR üòÉ This issue has now been resolved by #135 where support was dropped for v0.16.x and the installer updated to use v0.19.x
@rmiroballi Can you add the dco sign off please
Creating new PR with DCO
Tried to downgrade to 1.0.3, got the same error. Seems like the problem somewhere else. Downgrading composer to v0.16.2 didn't help ether.

HLF v1.0 and Composer 0.16 are old and have now further development being done. The demo was moved in line with supporting HLF V1.1 and equivalent version of composer and support for the demo running on HLF v1.0 was dropped.
This should now be fixed, closing.
Please do not merge until mark has approved the new license checker version
@awjh-ibm  the build says 2 files don't have the license, can you fix please
The build.sh is bringing down the 'latest' tag, which I think is 19? so it's not compatible with the connection.json being created.
Thanks Rob. What‚Äôs best practice here you think? Pin the versions ?
I would lean towards pinning the versions in the demo. We want the demo to always work. Bringing them up to the current stable can be a task that's deliberately taken.
when you say connection.json isn't compatible are you referring to hyperledger composer?
Yes, the one created in the build.sh is for version 16.x.
getting the same issue rolling composer-cli back to   0.16.6

I went back to 0.16.0 and most of the applications started. The builder is failing with 

>Configuration property "restServer" is not defined

Since the applications load with the latest tag, I wonder if the scripts were updated with any new requirements.

running the demo with DEMO_FABRIC_VERSION=hlfv11, it blows up pretty quick after running the `cat ... | bash`. The installer/hlfv11/build.sh has an error.

After fixing that, it brings down the 'next' version of composer, but dies on deploying the vehicle-manufacture-network.bna.

> Deploying business network from archive: vehicle-manufacture-network.bna
> Error: EISDIR: illegal operation on a directory, read
> Command failed

I'm going to fork this and fix a few things to see if we can get the hlfv1 running to start with.

I was able to get this application to build using master. Why is this still an open issue?
This should now be fixed, closing.

Hi @WiwiC,I think the issue is that the install script has been updated in the git repo however we have yet to release, this means that, as we have renamed from vehicle-lifecycle to vehicle-manufacture, the docker images of the correct names do not yet exist. This issue should hopefully be solved once we release.
This issue should now be resolved, closing
Resolves PR #117

I think it may be a problem with the composer connector npm package

https://www.npmjs.com/package/composer-connector-hlfv1


In node red I can see the message sent from the car builder to the manufacturer, but it errors 

"Error: creating resource error Failed to load connector module "composer-connector-hlfv1" for connection type "hlfv1". Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier-Unexpected identifier"

@dconroy some ES7 code slipped into the Node-RED nodes, but the official Docker image for Node-RED does not use Node.js 8 yet. I've spoken to the Node-RED lead who's going to fix that, but in the short term I've built and published my own image and updated the scripts to use that. Can you pull down the latest changes and try again?
works, thank you

~~Sample network appears on npm but version does not match 0.1.1 only at version 0.2.0~~

Seems as though there is a version at 0.1.14

Hmm think they were a hangover from when I had a play with multiuser mode I'll work at taking them out. Also found that the VDA completely crashes if there are no transactions so I will work to fix that in the same commit
Issue: https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/2524

Hello @DennisM330, 
This repo is not for the IoT example and is instead just contains the more basic demo. The repository containing the IoT example can be found at https://github.com/IBM-Blockchain/hotwheels. Please could you raise the issue again there?

I got the manufacturing app to come up by modifying the install.sh:
# Start the manufacturing application.
docker run \
-d \
--network composer_default \
--name manufacturing \
-e COMPOSER_BASE_URL=http://rest:3000 \
-e NODE_RED_BASE_URL=ws://node-red:1880 \
-p 6002:6001 \
hyperledger/vehicle-lifecycle-manufacturing:latest
Appears my port 6002 was in use by another app.
Will update readme for instructions to run locally. Some ionic instructions could be helpful for beginners.

Just tried this and don't get this error. I suspect there is some problem with the npm repository when you tried. Could you try again. If you still get an error could you provide details on your node level, npm level, whether you are running native or in a VM and if a VM are you sharing file systems in anyway ?
Closing as I believe Larissa has got this working now.
What was the fix? I am getting same error
see https://github.com/hyperledger/composer-sample-networks/issues/101 as this is an issue with the network rather than the sample application. Closing

Out of curiosity, where is this tutorial?  I thought we'd re-worked our online tutorials to use the commodity trading network rather than digital property, and here's the Tutorial list from the website:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7454304/29508806-dd9bd21a-864d-11e7-9f18-6a0284010c66.png)

Does this one live separately on GitHub or something?  If it's content covered in the Developer Guide (https://hyperledger.github.io/composer/tutorials/developer-guide.html), should we kill the duplicates?  Or if it's content not in there, should we be rolling it into our main doc tutorials?

@EdMoffatt  yeah, its a Github 'README' tutorial for Digital Property app - in a separate sample-applications repo -> https://github.com/hyperledger/composer-sample-applications/blob/master/packages/digitalproperty-app/README.md. Its a CLI based app tutorial (as opposed to the Trade 'Developer' tutorial, which builds a generated NG2 sample app).  But yes, your thinking is right - we will create a separate CLI based tutorial to add to main docs site, listed under Tutorials, as it is a different tutorial insight.  @rthatcher will be assigned this (once I can get him added as contributor) to work on when he's back next week. Created a separate issue in main Composer (Docs) repo for this -> https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/1942
assume this has been fixed. As PR has been merged. Closing
I think this has now been sorted.

How can I help?
@LarissaAuberger can you try this again by pulling down the latest changes?

I don't believe `logEntries` is useful. I would remove it.

What is `Date expiry` on InsuranceDetails. Is this valid? Also the `DateTime timestamp` seems vague. Is this the policy expiration date?

@dselman - thanks for the comments.  
I'll remove `logEntries`.

```
transaction InsureVehicle extends VehicleTransaction {
}
```

I meant to check whether `Date` was a valid type. :)  I don't need the Time element of `DateTime`.  I've found the docs now and will change it to `DateTime`. 
`DateTime expiry` is intended to be the expiry date of the policy.  `Timestamp` was intended to record when the policy was created.  I hadn't decided whether that would be the time when it was created by the insurer or when it was added to Blockchain.  Thinking about it a bit more maybe this should be when the policy commences.  So I think I will change these to be:

```
concept InsuranceDetails {
  --> Insurer insurer
  o String policyNumber
  o DateTime policyStart
  o DateTime policyEnd
}
```

Does this address your questions/concerns?

The issue here is that the version of the node modules that are being used in composer are at mismatched levels...  The backend Fabric is at the latest v1.0 beta level, but your composer is (I'm guessing at 0.7.5).

It is worth updating the node modules and make sure they are at 0.8.0 (released yesterday).

If you have other issues getting started please head to our Rocket-Chat channel. https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer
Thank you

`owner` in LandTitle is modelled as a relationship (a typed pointer) whereas pesonId in Person is a string, so the serialisation will be different.

However `"resource:net.biz.digitalPropertyNetwork.Person#%202312"` decodes as:
`resource:net.biz.digitalPropertyNetwork.Person# 2312`

So, I think there is a bug with resource IDs with `:` in their name.

The quickstart seems to be a missing a crucial step from the readme of this repository.

Following these steps fixed my issue: https://github.com/fabric-composer/sample-applications/tree/master/packages/getting-started

- support installation script progress via distribution codename restriction 
- enable a user to provide a codename as a parameter or lookup the parameter from the system directly if no parameter passed
- store and use the codename as a variable through the script to differentiate specific installation requirements for all supported versions

Please find attached files for the changes I've made.
The nc check was removed as part of dropping support for HLF 0.6.

Hello - welcome!  Many thanks for taking the time to take a look. 

Our working assumption is that the 'composer-cli' tools would have been installed globaly - so it doesn't need to be added as a dependency.  Though reading back just now on the docs we seem to have lost the important comment about doing this!

If we install this locally - some of the scripts might need to modified. .... but getting a simple getting started would be good.  Let me think on it a bit!

+1 on this ‚Äì¬†and I personally don't think it should be installed globally because getting-started projects should be a simple as possible (ie, as few deps as possible) ‚Äì¬†just locally should be fine as all invocation appears to be from npm scripts which will set the PATH correctly
We are going to stick with composer-cli installed globally for now -- it makes it easier for people to manage their diverse networks, using the `composer network list` commands etc.

@dselman ok, well just make sure to include it in the documentation ‚Äì¬†at the moment it's not. I had to figure out which `composer` the error was looking for ‚Äì initially thinking it was looking for https://getcomposer.org/

(not worth leaving this issue open until it's documented?)

Thanks everybody. Will be happy to start and try from a fresh/clean set-up, so as to confirm that if one is "doing the right thing" (following the step-by-step instruction) - it just works.

Of course I could "hack it" and get it to work somehow (especially as Simon was here in SF last week) - just want(ed) to make sure that this also works for others out of the box.

Sure, either way (cli installed globally or otherwise) - please let me know when we have this documented, and I'll be happy to give it a go. HTH, J
